The code representing the category to which this product belongs.
The date when this product was first made available for sale.
The date when this product was discontinued and no longer available for sale.
The name or title of the product.
A description or details about the product.
The price of the product.

customer_complaints_complaints.table_desc: This table stores information about customer complaints related to products.

cols.col_desc: The unique identifier for the customer complaint (Primary Key).
The identifier of the product that the complaint is related to.
The identifier of the customer who raised the complaint.
The code representing the outcome of the complaint.
The code representing the current status of the complaint.
The code representing the type of complaint.
The date when the complaint was raised.
The date when the complaint was closed or resolved.
The identifier of the staff member handling the complaint.

department_management_department.table_desc: This table stores information about departments within an organization.

cols.col_desc: The unique identifier for the department. This is the primary key.
The name of the department.
The date when the department was created.
The ranking or importance level of the department within the organization.
The annual budget allocated to the department, in billions of currency units.
The number of employees working in the department.

department_management_head.table_desc: This table stores information about the heads of various departments within an organization.

cols.col_desc: The unique identifier for each department head. This is likely the primary key.
The name of the department head.
The state where the department head was born.
The current age of the department head.

department_management_management.table_desc: This table stores information about the management structure of departments within an organization.

cols.col_desc: A unique identifier for each department. This is likely the primary key.
The identifier of the employee who is the head or manager of the department.

customers_and_products_contacts_addresse.table_desc: This table stores address information for customers, products, and contacts.

cols.col_desc: The unique identifier for the address record. This is likely the primary key.
The street address line containing the building number and street name.
The city name for the address.
The zip or postal code for the address.
The state, province, or county for the address.
The country for the address.

customers_and_products_contacts_products.table_desc: This table stores information about products offered by the company.

cols.col_desc: The unique identifier for each product. This is the primary key.
A code representing the type or category of the product.
The name or description of the product.
The price of the product.

customers_and_products_contacts_customer.table_desc: This table stores information about customers, including their contact details and payment method.

cols.col_desc: The unique identifier for the customer. This is likely the primary key.
The code representing the customer's preferred payment method.
A unique number assigned to the customer.
The name of the customer.
The address of the customer.
The phone number of the customer.
The email address of the customer.

customers_and_products_contacts_contacts.table_desc: This table stores contact information for customers and products.

cols.col_desc: The unique identifier for the contact (Primary Key).
The identifier linking the contact to a customer.
The gender of the contact.
The first name of the contact.
The last name of the contact.
The phone number of the contact.

customers_and_products_contacts_customer.table_desc: This table stores the history of customer addresses over time.

cols.col_desc: The unique identifier for the customer, likely the primary key or part of a composite primary key.
The unique identifier for the address associated with the customer during the specified date range.
The start date when the customer was associated with the given address.
The end date when the customer was associated with the given address, or NULL if it's the current address.

customers_and_products_contacts_customer.table_desc: This table stores information about customer orders, including the order ID, customer ID, order date, and order status code.

cols.col_desc: The unique identifier for the customer order. This is likely the primary key.
The identifier for the customer who placed the order, referencing the customers table.
The date when the customer order was placed.
A code representing the current status of the customer order, such as 'pending', 'shipped', or 'cancelled'.

customers_and_products_contacts_order_it.table_desc: This table stores information about order items, including the order ID, product ID, and quantity ordered.

cols.col_desc: The unique identifier for the order item. This is likely the primary key.
The ID of the order that this item belongs to, referencing the orders table.
The ID of the product that was ordered, referencing the products table.
The quantity of the product that was ordered.

company_1_works_on.table_desc: This table stores information about the projects that employees of a company work on, including the employee's social security number, the project number, and the number of hours worked on that project.

cols.col_desc: The employee's social security number, which serves as a unique identifier for the employee. This column is likely part of the primary key.
The project number, which identifies the specific project the employee is working on. This column is likely part of the primary key.
The number of hours the employee has worked on the specified project.

company_1_employee.table_desc: This table stores employee information for a company.

cols.col_desc: First name of the employee
Middle initial of the employee
Last name of the employee
Social security number of the employee (Primary Key)
Birth date of the employee
Address of the employee
Gender of the employee
Salary of the employee
Social security number of the employee's supervisor
Department number the employee works in

company_1_department.table_desc: This table stores information about departments within a company.

cols.col_desc: The name of the department
The unique identifier number for the department

company_1_project.table_desc: This table stores information about projects undertaken by a company.

cols.col_desc: The name of the project
The unique identification number for the project (Primary Key)
The location where the project is being carried out

cols.col_desc: The employee's Social Security Number, which serves as the primary key (PK) linking the dependent to the employee.
The name of the dependent.
The sex of the dependent.
The birth date of the dependent.
The relationship of the dependent to the employee.

company_1_department_locations.table_desc: This table stores information about the locations of different departments within a company.

cols.col_desc: The unique identifier or number assigned to each department.

workshop_paper_workshop.table_desc: This table stores information about workshops, including their IDs, dates, venues, and names.

The date when the workshop is/was held.
The location or venue where the workshop takes place.
The name or title of the workshop.

workshop_paper_submission.table_desc: This table stores information about paper submissions for a workshop, including submission details, scores, author information, and the college affiliation.

cols.col_desc: The unique identifier for each paper submission. This is likely the primary key.
The scores or ratings assigned to the submitted paper, potentially by reviewers or judges.
The name or details of the author who submitted the paper.
The college or university affiliation of the author who submitted the paper.

workshop_paper_acceptance.table_desc: This table stores information about the acceptance status of paper submissions to workshops.

cols.col_desc: The unique identifier for a paper submission.
The unique identifier for the workshop the paper was submitted to.
The acceptance status of the paper submission, e.g. 'accepted' or 'rejected'.

epinions_1_item.table_desc: This table stores information about items in the Epinions dataset.

cols.col_desc: The unique identifier for an item (Primary Key).

epinions_1_review.table_desc: This table stores reviews of items by users in the Epinions dataset.

cols.col_desc: The unique identifier for the author (reviewer) of the review.
The unique identifier for the user who wrote the review.
The unique identifier for the item being reviewed.
The rating score given by the user for the reviewed item.
The rank or helpfulness score assigned to the review by other users.

epinions_1_useracct.table_desc: This table stores user account information for the Epinions website.

cols.col_desc: The unique identifier for a user account. This is the primary key.
The name associated with the user account.

epinions_1_trust.table_desc: This table stores trust relationships between users in the Epinions network.

cols.col_desc: The user ID of the user who is expressing trust towards another user.
The user ID of the user who is being trusted by the source user.
A boolean value indicating whether the source user trusts (1) or distrusts (0) the target user.

party_host_party.table_desc: This table stores information about parties hosted by a group of hosts, including details such as the party theme, location, the first and last years the party was held, and the number of hosts involved.

cols.col_desc: The unique identifier for the party hosted. This is likely the primary key.
The theme or concept around which the party was organized.

party_host_host.table_desc: This table stores information about party hosts.

cols.col_desc: The unique identifier for the party host. This is the primary key.
The name of the party host.
The nationality of the party host.
The age of the party host.

party_host_party_host.table_desc: This table stores information about the hosts assigned to parties.

cols.col_desc: The unique identifier for the party. This is a foreign key referencing the party table and is part of the composite primary key.

product_catalog_attribute_definitions.table_desc: This table stores definitions of attributes for products in the catalog.

cols.col_desc: The unique identifier for the product attribute (Primary Key).
The name of the product attribute.

cols.col_desc: The unique identifier for the product catalog. This is likely the primary key.

cols.col_desc: The unique identifier for each catalog entry. This is likely the primary key.
